full_description:
DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Drone

The DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual is ideal for a Business start-up Drone, this versatile quad-copter packs a lot of features that can be utilized across various sectors thanks to an additional set of accessories that are carried over from the DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise. The DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual includes a dual camera that houses two lenses – standard visual (zoom) and FLIR (Forward Looking Infra-Red) – speaker, floodlight, and beacon. The drone itself features the standard DJI Mavic style fold-out arms which provide a quicker setup time and deployment, within minutes if the situation requires. Some examples of sectors that this drone would be used for are; SAR (Search and Rescue), Emergency Services (Police, Fire, Coastguard), Commercial, Private and Industrial Inspections (visual and thermal), Restricted Area Control, Film production, aerial photography and many more.

Mode Elements

Some of the features include the advanced obstacle avoidance system reduces the risk of accidental contact with other objects improving the safety of each flight, Data Security, GPS timestamping, DJI AirSense, Ocusync 2.0 to name a few. A great feature that DJI has put some thought into is the inclusion of a Discreet Mode, this allows you to turn off the LEDs when performing a night mission to ensure you are not being obtrusive to anyone during your flight.

Perfect for Easy transport

The DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual blazes the trail for Commercial Drone Businesses wanting to access multiple sectors. In the ever-growing drone market, trying to choose the right drone for your business can almost certainly leave you confused, lost and drowning in a mass of information. This drone may be small when compared to others on the market, but don’t let that put you off as this little terrier of the sky has a bite bigger than its bark! Being a smaller drone though does have its advantages: compact and easy to store therefore saving space, easily carried/transported to remote areas without the use of vehicles, fit and access small spaces and tight spots, can be operated from small take-off/landing areas.

Powerful and Portable thermal Imaging

Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual Drone features a three-axis gimbal stabilized camera housing a side-by-side 4K sensor for capturing visible light and a FLIR imaging sensor for capturing thermal data. Together these sensors allow pilots to perform flights at night, as well as fly in complex daytime conditions like fog and smoke. Users can select from multiple intelligent display modes in the DJI Pilot flight control app to visualize data from the dual-sensor camera: FLIR MSX – A new feature that combines data from the visual and thermal cameras in real time to enhance visual details, helping pilots quickly identify and interpret critical data that may not be immediately visible to the naked eye. This Drone has features like Spot Meter – Displays the average temperature of an object, helping pilots monitor and measure critical or hazardous objects while maintaining a safe distance. Area Measurement – Displays the average, lowest, and highest temperature, as well as the corresponding locations of each area, allowing inspectors to quickly assess objects and determine if an asset may be overheating. Isotherm – Allows pilots to designate specific temperature ranges to be displayed using a custom color palette so objects within the range relay higher contrast and better visibility. This feature includes custom profiles to aid search and rescue pilots in identifying people and to help firefighters identify hot spots in fires, as well as a custom profile setting for added flexibility.

Refined Imaging And Enhanced Vision

The imaging system has been developed with two goals in mind; assisting pilots in close-range missions; and ensuring captured data is more relevant and trusted than ever. DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual Edition Drone is launched with a purpose of enhanced image visibility on all your captured data, Isotherm helps you get accurate heat measurements on a variety of objects and scenarios. You can Visualize scenarios in real time, monitor and measure objects on site more safely and efficiently so you can make the most informed decisions. Enhance image visibility for on-the ground team missions, Enhance image visibility for improved situational awareness and Create predefined isotherm setting.

Safety Features

DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual Edition Drone comes with Shield Basic properties that include: User/Pilot Error, Signal Interference, Collision, Water Damage and Drop Damage.

Emergency response

The DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual Edition Drone has the ability to go from packed away to in the air in mere minutes during emergency situations, making response times more effective. Using the Mavic 2 Enterprise is a cost-effective alternative to traditional helicopters and can help respond tactically to unexpected missions. Collect the necessary situational data to help minimize unforeseen dangers to crew and their surroundings, allowing for a safer mission.

DJI Smart Controller

The Mavic Duals smart controller was built for aircrafts with OcuSync 2.0 and made to enhance your outdoor flying experience with its ultra-bright 5.5-inch 1080p display. Allowing for clear visibility and brighter images even in less than desirable conditions like direct sunlight. It boasts intuitive controls and pre-installed apps like SkyTalk and DJI Go helping you get in the air more quickly than ever before. Third-party apps are also supported, so drone pilots have a complete choice when it comes to operational controls. The smart controller lets you connect to a HDMI port and microSD card slot, and operates at 1000 cd/m2 brightness.

Standard Remote Controller

The Mavic dual’s standard remote controller boasts 135 minutes of battery life when fully charged - leaving you plenty of time to capture what you need in the field. It is also built with an ergonomic design that allows for easy storage with its foldable body and detachable sticks. This design works exceptionally well with smartphones and gives an enhanced operational experience to use the DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual Edition Drone.

full_description:
DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Drone

The DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise is a foldable, portable, long-range flying camera and accessory system that adapts well to uses by first responders and businesses that routinely inspect hard-to-reach assets. This affordable quadcopter has a 2x optical and 3x digital camera, allowing a broader view or a close-up look at developing situations or infrastructure. The camera shoots sharp 12 MP stills and vibration-free 4K ultra-high-definition video. It transmits live video over its full 4.97-mile range in 1080p high definition. It stays aloft for up to half an hour. Hover safely over wildfires or urban infernos. Perform search-and-rescue operations over limited-access terrain or bodies of water. Broadcast warnings or directions using the easily mounted loudspeaker. Record at night with Snap-on flood lamps. Observe suspects or track escapees. Get close to cell towers, high-tension lines, bridges and high-rise buildings without compromising worker safety. Examine storm-damaged roofs from the ground.

Mavic Lens with Zoom

The Mavic 2 Enterprise camera has an optical zoom lens with two focal lengths—24 and 48mm in 35mm equivalent. Zoom capabilities mean personnel get a closer look without taking on added risk. The Mavic 2 Enterprise camera has 2x optical magnification. Give the command through the DJI Go 4 flight program, and the focal length of the lens changes instantly. Bring objects visually closer—ideal for police surveillance, fire observation or industrial inspections. The camera also has a 3x digital zoom with minimal loss of sharpness.

Perfect for Easy transport

The DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Zoom blazes the trail for Commercial Drone Businesses wanting to access multiple sectors. In the ever-growing drone market, trying to choose the right drone for your business can almost certainly leave you confused, lost and drowning in a mass of information. This drone may be small when compared to others on the market, but don’t let that put you off as this little terrier of the sky has a bite bigger than its bark! Being a smaller drone though does have its advantages: compact and easy to store therefore saving space, easily carried/transported to remote areas without the use of vehicles, fit and access small spaces and tight spots, can be operated from small take-off/landing areas.

Intelligent Flight Battery

Each Intelligent Flight Battery can power the DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise for up to a half-hour maximum flight time. Using the included accessories slightly reduces flight time. The batteries self-heat from about 43 degrees Fahrenheit down to 14 F. Heating also can be switched manually with the remote controller. The batteries protect themselves from harmful power levels when stored. Mavic 2 batteries are interchangeable with those of the Mavic 2 Zoom and Mavic 2 Pro. The included Mavic 2 charger and available charging hub will charge the batteries of any Mavic 2 model. A full charge takes about an hour. A hub will charge up to four batteries in sequence, starting with the battery that has the highest reserve, then automatically moving on to the next highest.

Refined Imaging And Enhanced Vision

The imaging system has been developed with two goals in mind; assisting pilots in close-range missions; and ensuring captured data is more relevant and trusted than ever. DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Zoom Edition Drone is launched with a purpose of enhanced image visibility on all your captured data, zoom features helps you get accurate measurements on a variety of objects and scenarios. You can Visualize scenarios in real time, monitor and measure objects on site more safely and efficiently so you can make the most informed decisions. Enhance image visibility for on-the ground team missions, Enhance image visibility for improved situational awareness and Create predefined setting.

Safety Features

DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Zoom Edition Drone comes with Shield Basic properties that include: User/Pilot Error, Signal Interference, Collision, Water Damage and Drop Damage.

Dynamic Zoom

The imaging system has been developed with two goals in mind: assisting pilots in close-range missions, and ensuring captured data is more relevant and trusted than ever. Improved FlightAutonomy gives you omnidirectional obstacle sensing, an advanced sensing system comprised of 8 high resolution vision and 2 infrared sensors placed on the sides of the aircraft. These powerful set of sensors work together to determine the relative speed and distance between the aircraft and an object, so you can fly and hover with more stability than ever in a wide range of open and complex environments. Stay close to the action – but away from the danger. The Mavic 2 Enterprise is equipped with a 2x optical, 3x digital zoom camera that lets you operate in close range missions without putting yourself in harm’s way.

DJI Smart Controller

The Mavic Zoom's smart controller was built for aircrafts with OcuSync 2.0 and made to enhance your outdoor flying experience with its ultra-bright 5.5-inch 1080p display. Allowing for clear visibility and brighter images even in less than desirable conditions like direct sunlight. It boasts intuitive controls and pre-installed apps like SkyTalk and DJI Go helping you get in the air more quickly than ever before. Third-party apps are also supported, so drone pilots have a complete choice when it comes to operational controls. The smart controller lets you connect to a HDMI port and microSD card slot, and operates at 1000 cd/m2 brightness.

Standard Remote Controller

The Mavic Zoom's standard remote controller boasts 135 minutes of battery life when fully charged - leaving you plenty of time to capture what you need in the field. It is also built with an ergonomic design that allows for easy storage with its foldable body and detachable sticks. This design works exceptionally well with smartphones and gives an enhanced operational experience to use the DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Zoom Edition Drone.

full_description:
DJI Matrice 350 RTK Drone

The DJI Matrice 350 RTK Drone is a reliable and powerful industrial drone with high-performance flying, precision positioning, and a wide range of payload choices. The drone has a folding design, an IP55-rated body, and a dual-battery system with a flying time of up to 55 minutes. The drone can also employ up to three DJI gimbals, including the Zenmuse H20 series, Zenmuse P1, and Zenmuse L1. The drone offers an omnidirectional vision system that detects and avoids obstacles in all directions, as well as an infrared sensing system for precise landing. The DJI Matrice 350 RTK Drone also has an RTK module that provides centimeter-level positional precision and is compatible with the NTRIP network RTK. The DJI O3 Enterprise Transmission technology provides clear and steady video transmission up to 20 kilometers distant. The drone comes with a 7-inch touchscreen remote controller that supports Wi-Fi 6 and Bluetooth 5.1.

High-Performance Flight

The DJI Matrice 350 RTK Drone features a robust propulsion system that allows it to fly at speeds of up to 23 meters per second and withstand gusts of up to 12 meters per second. The drone boasts a dual-battery system with hot-swapping and self-heating capabilities, allowing for up to 55 minutes of flying duration without payloads. In addition, the drone includes a smart flying mode that automatically modifies flight characteristics based on payload arrangement and ambient conditions. The drone has several flying modes, including N, S, T, and A, as well as intelligent functions like waypoint mission, orbit, spotlight, and active track.

Precise Positioning

The DJI Matrice 350 RTK Drone features an RTK module with centimeter-level positional precision and NTRIP network RTK capability. For improved locating performance, the drone also has a GNSS module that supports GPS, GLONASS, BeiDou, and Galileo satellites. The drone can save satellite observation data for post-processed kinematics (PPK), which may be used with the DJI Terra software to build high-precision maps and models. When the GNSS signal is lost or weak, the RTK-aided inertial navigation system (RAINS) maintains high-precision positioning.

Omnidirectional Vision System

The DJI Matrice 350 RTK Drone features an omnidirectional vision system that detects and avoids obstacles in all directions, as well as an infrared sensor system for precise landing. Six pairs of cameras are situated on the front, rear, left, right, top, and bottom of the drone, as well as an infrared sensor at the bottom. Depending on the surroundings and speed of the drone, the vision system can identify obstructions from 0.7 m to 40 m away. The vision system also enables APAS (Advanced Pilot Assistance System) mode, which automatically prepares the optimal flying route to avoid obstructions. The infrared sensor device can detect obstructions from 0.1 m to 8 m away and has a range of vision of 30° (15°). The infrared sensing technology is intended for big, diffuse, and reflecting obstacles (reflectivity > 10%). The drone also contains an LED auxiliary light that offers good lighting up to 5 meters away. The LED light features a steady glow mode with a frequency of 60 Hz. The drone also contains an FPV camera that gives a 1080p live view with a field of view of 142° and a frame rate of 30 fps.

Intelligent Flight Battery

The DJI Matrice 350 RTK Drone is powered by the TB65 Intelligent Flying Battery, a high-capacity Li-ion battery that gives the drone up to 55 minutes of flying time. The battery has 5880 mAh of capacity, 44.76 V of voltage, and 263.2 Wh of energy. Intelligent functions such as self-discharge prevention, overcharge and discharge protection, low-temperature protection, and balancing charging are also supported by the battery. The battery may be charged using the provided power adapter, the optional DJI 100W USB-C Power Adapter, or the optional vehicle charger. The battery is also compatible with the optional Intelligent Battery Station, which can charge up to eight TB65 batteries and four WB37 batteries at the same time. The battery features four LED indicators that reflect the remaining power level and battery condition.

Multi-Payload Support

The DJI Matrice 350 RTK Drone is compatible with up to three DJI gimbals, including the Zenmuse H20 series, Zenmuse P1, and Zenmuse L1. The Zenmuse H20 series is a multi-sensor hybrid camera with zoom, wide-angle, thermal, and laser rangefinder capabilities. Zenmuse P1 is a full-frame camera capable of capturing 45 MP images as well as 3D data for photogrammetry applications. The Zenmuse L1 lidar sensor produces point clouds and digital elevation models for surveying and mapping applications. The drone can easily swap between gimbals and control them independently or concurrently. Third-party payloads are also supported by the drone using the SkyPort V2.0 converter or the DJI X-Port adapter.

product_page_short_description: Up to 9.3-Mile Control via O3 Pro
full_description:
DJI Inspire 3 Drone

The DJI Inspire 3 is an all-in-one 8K camera drone allows experienced filmmakers to maximize the possibilities of any image and master the unseen. Waypoint Pro, which was created specifically for aerial cinematography, allows for flight-route and shoot preparation with a variety of customizable parameters. An novel automated shooting experience may be readily achieved with the new Repeatable Routes and 3D Dolly modes. Furthermore, RTK centimeter-level location ensures more precise flight planning and execution. Use Waypoint Pro to handle even the most difficult sequences, whether you're shooting alone or with a professional crew. The X9-8K Air is an 8K full-frame, 3-axis gimbal camera that was made specifically for the Inspire 3. With double the DFOV of the Inspire 2, it complements a newly added 1/1.8" FPV camera. Thanks to a programmable obstacle avoidance system, integrated centimeter-level RTK precision, and tracking solutions that enable precise and repeatable shots, they work together to assist shoot professional video and complex shots.

Innovative Design

The Inspire 3 Drone is a professional camera drone that features a sleek, modern design that completely considers aerodynamics to minimize air resistance. The vertical ascend/descend speed has increased from 6 m/s and 4 m/s to 8 m/s, while the maximum dive speed has increased from 9 m/s of Inspire 2 to 10 m/s. Strong maneuverability allows for up to 28 minutes of extended flight time and responsive, precise handling. For a sleek, contemporary industrial style, the FPV camera, visual sensors, location antennas, and storage card slot all have designs that are smoothly blended into the airframe. With a completely redesigned design that accommodates 360° Pan and Tilt Boost frameworks, the DJI Inspire 3 Drone carries on the tradition of the Inspire series' iconic transformable configuration. Cinematographers can record visually spectacular and inventive pictures with the gimbal's assistance for obstruction-free 80° upward-angle shooting when the landing gear is lowered. Every aspect of Inspire 3, from the exterior to the interior, was well thought out and optimized.

High-Mobility Precision with RTK Positioning

High-precision RTK positioning technology is integrated into the DJI Inspire 3 Drone to reach centimeter-level accuracy. This technology is used in various fields, including architecture and surveying. Compared to traditional meter-level positioning afforded by Global Navigation Satellite Systems (GNSS), RTK not only enhances flying stability but also flight-route planning accuracy. This results in a significant boost in creative productivity. The unique stacked ceramic architecture of the RTK antennas built into the aircraft allows for dual-frequency positioning down to the centimeter level and facilitates three GNSS types: GPS, BeiDou, and Galileo. By setting a D-RTK 2 Mobile Station or turning on an RTK network, users can achieve exceptionally accurate positioning without the need to attach any additional modules.

Built-In Stacked Ceramic Antenna

An integrated stacking ceramic antenna on the front and back of the Inspire 3 Drone has strong anti-magnetic interference capabilities to further enhance flying safety and accuracy. The aircraft will automatically fly on the same path while maintaining all pre-set parameters, including camera settings, gimbal angle, altitude, and speed, when it uses repeatable routes. Cinematographers can easily generate long-duration timelapses that show transitions like day to night or season to season by repeating the same flight mission or by flying at different times in the same location.

Nine Omnidirectional Sensing System

Nine sensors on the Inspire 3 allow for a powerful omnidirectional sensing system that can identify objects in all directions and offer complete flying protection. Every one of the four landing arms now has a fisheye camera, a first. With this design, obstacles from the airframe can be avoided when the landing gear is lifted, and when it is dropped, horizontal obstacle detection is possible. To help ensure increased flight safety and creative freedom, the DJI Inspire 3 Drone also has a new customisable function. Obstacle detection in the horizontal, upward, and downward directions can be turned on or off separately, and the obstacle alert range can be manually adjusted to accommodate various situations. Even with active avoidance disabled, users can still see the distance to obstacles in real time on the navigation display and hear an audible alarm when one approaches within a predetermined range without the aircraft making an automatic maneuver to avoid it. Professional aerial teams now have additional options to work with when trying to generate more intricate camera language.

FPV Camera with Ultra-Wide Night Vision

The new 1/1.8-inch sensor FPV camera on the DJI Inspire 3 Drone has 3μm pixel size, 161° ultra-wide DFOV, and 1080p/60fps live feed transmission capability. The DFOV is roughly double that of its predecessor. With its enhanced light-sensing ability, this FPV camera ensures higher levels of flight safety by enabling pilots to see their surroundings clearly and vividly, especially at night.

8K Full-Frame Imaging System

The X9-8K Air, DJI's lightest full-frame three-axis gimbal camera, was designed specifically for the Inspire 3 to elevate drone filmmaking. It has DJI's most recent image processing technology, CineCore 3.0, which can record internal video at up to 8K/25 frames per second for CinemaDNG and 8K/75 frames per second for Apple ProRes RAW, satisfying the demands of high-end TV and film productions. 8K refers to extremely high-definition aerial video with clarity that astounds viewers when viewed on bigger screens while maintaining a texture that is true to life and similar to what the human eye sees. The X9-8K Air's sensor is fully utilized in RAW, offering a ton of room for color grading and graphic effects. More creative editing choices are available when using the X9-8K Air in S&Q mode, which allows internal recording of up to full-frame 4K/120fps ProRes RAW footage without cropping.

DJI Cinema Color System (DCCS): Syncing Timecode for Multiple Cameras

The DJI Cinema Color System, which builds on DJI's advanced color science and technology, enables the X9-8K Air to maintain true colors that completely change the appearance of aerial filmmaking. This holds true for both urban and natural locations, and it also correctly depicts skin tones under various lighting scenarios. In order to meet the demands of post-editing workflows in the film industry, DCCS guarantees seamless color matching between X9-8K Air and ground-based cinema cameras like DJI Ronin 4D. This uniform color style is delivered from air to ground. Equipment on the ground and in the air can synchronize timecode through the aircraft's 3.5mm connector. When editing a large amount of material from several cameras, timecode sync greatly simplifies and expedites the process.

O3 Pro, Cinema-Grade Video Transmission

With DJI's cinema-grade video transmission system, O3 Pro, the DJI Inspire 3 Drone can transmit video up to 15 km in single control mode and 12 km in dual control mode. The FPV camera and gimbal camera feature ultra-low latency of 90ms and support 1080p/60fps live feeds. O3 Pro offers transmission distance, latency, and stability improvements that represent a generational jump beyond those of the Lightbridge video transmission system of Inspire 2. To satisfy the demands of UHD monitoring and livestreaming on set, 4K/30fps live feeds are now available with a maximum transmission distance of 5km for the first time.

Fastest 1TB Storage Included

With the accompanying USB-C to USB-C connector, you can read the film on a computer directly without a card reader. The DJI PROSSD 1TB has a maximum read speed of 900MBps. With its four 360-degree rotating wheels, two side grips, and an extensible handle, the newly designed trolley case makes transitioning and moving about a breeze. For further security, there are two numbered locks installed. One airplane, one X9-8K Air gimbal camera, two RC Plus remote controllers, four lenses, twelve batteries, two battery charging hubs, three propeller sets, and more may all be stored in the thoughtfully built trolley case. Fresh quick-release folding propellers don't need to be reinstalled before every flight, making them simple to store.

Built for All-Day Shooting: Dual-Battery System

The new TB51 dual-battery system that powers the DJI Inspire 3 Drone makes use of the most recent advancements in battery chemistry technology to maximize dependability and performance. Comparing TB51 to TB50, the former has a greater voltage and the latter is smaller, lighter, and more streamlined. They have a maximum flying length of 28 minutes and enable hot swapping, which makes easy continuous operation possible. They also include a new battery release. The battery will activate an auto-heating feature if its temperature drops below 10° C (50° F). This will ensure that the battery can continue to work properly during flight, even in environments with -20° C (-4° F) temperatures. The brand-new foldable battery charging hub finds the ideal ratio between storage capacity and charging effectiveness. It has room for eight batteries. It can charge two batteries to 90% capacity in 35 minutes or eight cells to 100% capacity in 160 minutes when using the Fast mode. You may also use the accompanying 65W USB-C connector to charge an RC Plus.
